definition: coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: A large sum of money was spent in building the tower.
sentences.chinese: 建造那座塔花費大量錢財。

sentences.english: He's been charged with extorting money from several shopkeepers.
sentences.chinese: 他受到指控，罪名是向幾個店主勒索錢財。

sentences.english: He's frittered away the money his father left him.
sentences.chinese: 他揮霍掉了父親留給他的錢財。

sentences.english: Her relatives leeched her for her money like parasites.
sentences.chinese: 她的親戚像寄生蟲似地“榨取”她的錢財。

sentences.english: Taxpayers are grumbling about the waste of government money,as usual.
sentences.chinese: 納稅人又像往常一樣抱怨政府浪費錢財。

sentences.english: I'm often asked what I miss about my old world of lucre and business?
sentences.chinese: 我經常自問關於以前的錢財和生意，我會懷念什麼。

sentences.english: They went to  great expense to educate their son.
sentences.chinese: 他們爲教育孩子花費了大量錢財和心血。

sentences.english: I have the preference for learning to wealth.
sentences.chinese: 我寧願有好學問，而不要錢財。

sentences.english: Randolph cannot inherit his uncle's money until he is of age.
sentences.chinese: 倫道夫要等到成年之後方能繼承他叔叔的錢財。

sentences.english: It makes sense that money can never be brought or taken, as always said.
sentences.chinese: 老生常談的錢財生不帶來死不帶去是有道理的。

sentences.english: Have the effortless thou this natural of the location, make Mo to namely don't worry money problem.
sentences.chinese: 有古易這個本地人，弄墨到是不擔心錢財問題。

sentences.english: But how easy will it be to get hold of their money?
sentences.chinese: 但是要將富豪的錢財乾坤大挪移過來，談何容易？

sentences.english: Gamblers and confidence men prey on Jack and many of his friends.
sentences.chinese: 賭棍和騙子常靠騙取傑克及其許多朋友的錢財過活。

sentences.english: What do you think about giving money to beggars?
sentences.chinese: 你是怎樣看待施捨錢財幫助乞丐呢？

sentences.english: In verse 7 we are reminded that money talks.
sentences.chinese: 第7節告訴我們，錢財可以屈枉公正。

sentences.english: In this life, I am gladdened by God, not by how.
sentences.chinese: 我的生命中，我不因錢財的多少而快樂，乃。

definition: to suffer losses/to come to grief/to lose out/to get the worst of it/to be at a disadvantage/unfortunately
to be cheated/to be taken in/to be hoodwinked
just in case/if by any chance/contingency
